fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.bases

Interface RegistrationCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public interface RegistrationCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    The component interface RegistrationCI defines the registration service of home energy managers (HEM), which allows digital electric equipments to register to the HEM for their remote control.

    Description

    This component interface is part of a master course project aiming at developing a mock-up of a future home energy manager connected to a smart grid.

    The designed home energy manager requires a public component interface to control digital electric equipments, but in practice, home energy manager providers and equipment providers may not have the same interfaces. The idea here is to also define a public XML schema that allows an equipment provider to provide the home energy manager with a description of how to make the link between the home energy manager required interface and its own offered interface. The home energy manager can then generate a specific connector that will accept calls following the required interface but that will call the equipment respecting its offered interface.

    This component interface is offered by the home energy manager and is meant to be required by equipments that want to be connected to it.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-09-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean register(java.lang.String uid, java.lang.String controlPortURI, java.lang.String xmlControlAdapter)
      register a specific equipment on the home energy manager and connect it using the description of its offered interface.
      boolean registered(java.lang.String uid)
      return true if the equipment has been registered on this home energy manager and false if uid is null or empty or if it is unknown to the home energy manager.
      void unregister(java.lang.String uid)
      unregister a specific equipment from the home energy manager and disconnect it.

      • registered

        boolean registered(java.lang.String uid)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        return true if the equipment has been registered on this home energy manager and false if uid is null or empty or if it is unknown to the home energy manager.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        uid - unique identifier of the equipment (e.g., serial number).
        Returns:
        true if the equipment has been registered on this home energy manager.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • register

        boolean register(java.lang.String uid,
                 java.lang.String controlPortURI,
                 java.lang.String xmlControlAdapter)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        register a specific equipment on the home energy manager and connect it using the description of its offered interface.

        Contract

         pre     uid != null && !uid.isEmpty()
 pre     controlPortURI != null && !controlPortURI.isEmpty()
 pre     xmlControlAdapter == null || !xmlControlAdapter.isEmpty()
 pre     !registered(uid)
 post    !return || registered(uid)
        Parameters:
        uid - unique identifier of the equipment (e.g., serial number).
        controlPortURI - URI of the control inbound port of the equipment.
        xmlControlAdapter - XML document file (as a string), which describes how to link the required interface to the offered interface of this equipment, null if the equipment offers exactly the required interface.
        Returns:
        true if the registration succeeded, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

 pre     registered(uid)
 post    !registered(uid)

        uid - unique identifier of the equipment (e.g., serial number).
